articles.title: AI: well, to show you not how smart some are, but how stupid some people are, Albania just appointed a fully AI 'minister' in its government! Diella, who is powered by artificial intelligence
articles.author: Dr. Paul Alexander
articles.summary: Diella will be responsible for all public procurement in Albania. She is powered by artificial intelligence. She has already been introduced to Albanian citizens as she powers the country's e-Albania platform, which allows citizens to access almost all government services digitally.

articles.title: How Oakland teachers are using — or avoiding — AI in the classroom
articles.author: Ashley McBride
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence software is reshaping the K-12 education landscape. There is no detailed policy in the Oakland Unified School District. Some teachers embrace AI, while others reject it. Oakland Technical High School has formed a group to study AI in education. OUSD's instructional technology coordinator is working on a comprehensive AI policy.

articles.title: Parents press Senate for AI rules
articles.author: The Hill
articles.summary: Parents testify before lawmakers that AI chatbots drove their children to do things they should have spent the summer preparing for their junior year, getting their driver's license, and thinking about college. They want guardrails on artificial intelligence chatbots as they testified on Tuesday.

articles.title: How Ai Technology Could Help Control Type 2 Diabetes
articles.author: Hispanos Press
articles.summary: A new study by Cleveland Clinic shows the potential benefits of using AI technology to help people control their type 2 diabetes, according to a study by the clinic's researchers. The study was published in the journal Hispanics Press. It claims that AI technology could revolutionize the treatment of type two diabetes.

articles.title: SAS Chief Technology Officer named to North Carolina governor's AI Leadership Council
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: Bryan Harris is the CTO at data and AI company SAS. North Carolina Governor Josh Stein has named him to his new AI Leadership Council. The council convenes elected and appointed officials and representatives from technology and academia to advise and support the Governor and state agencies on AI strategy, policy and training.

articles.title: Why AI and SEO are inseparable in modern marketing
articles.author: Cristal Dyer
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence and search engine optimisation (SEOS) are inseparable. Businesses use AI to predict trends, automate tasks and create content that aligns directly with search intent. Google's RankBrain uses AI to understand the context of search queries instead of only looking at keywords.

articles.title: Graves: Things AI can't do
articles.author: JASE GRAVES
articles.summary: Goldman Sachs predicts artificial intelligence may displace up to 300 million jobs by 2027. AI is already doing amazing things, such as making teachers all over the country wish they had an IV drip of margaritas when they grade essays. There are still practical tasks that AI can't perform.

articles.title: Some judges move beyond fines to keep lawyers' AI errors in check
articles.summary: Some judges are experimenting with alternatives to traditional court sanctions to deter lawyers from relying on chatbots and other AI tools without checking their work in legal filings. AI is often used to generate fake case citations and other artificial intelligence errors in legal files, which is a problem for some judges.

articles.title: Illinois cracks down on AI-generated child porn: ‘Obscene is obscene' – FOX32 (Chicago)
articles.author: Joanna Brown
articles.summary: There are federal laws outlawing child porn material generated with or without AI. Not all states have a similar law. Illinois is one of the few states that has such a law, and it's effective in that state only.   Â

articles.title: Global AI war will be won in the key arena of education and training
articles.author: South China Morning Post
articles.summary: Nations chase cutting-edge technologies and data centres heavy with graphics processing units (GPUs) in the global race for artificial intelligence (AI) technology. The focus is on big data, big data centres and data centers heavy with the latest graphics processors (PGP).

articles.title: Figure AI Humanoid Robots Valued at $39 Billion
articles.author: Brian Wang
articles.summary: Figure AI has raised $1 billion and is valued at $39 billion. The company has three main goals: Scaling into real life, getting humanoid robots into homes and factories and building beefy GPU setups with Nvidia tech to train robot brains faster. Home robots need proven safety and could be 7-12 years off. Commercial uses like warehouses are closer, but still pilots.

articles.title: What the tech giants aren't telling us
articles.author: Tom Chivers
articles.summary: Eliezer Yudkowsky and Nate Soares are worried about the deadly potential of AI. They want a global agreement, backed up with the teeth that global anti-nuclear-proliferation treaties have, banning all frontier AI research. If AI companies succeed in making a superintelligent AI, they will be more powerful than humans.

articles.author: Tia Ewing
articles.summary: Illinois passed a law that makes AI-created child porn as illegal as real images. The law is aimed at preventing the spread of AI-generated child porn on the internet. There are hundreds of thousands of reports of AI child porn every year. Many of them are linked to Illinois.

articles.title: Marketing Expert Tony Hayes Reveals AI Traffic Strategy That Converts 6X Better Than Google Search

articles.summary: Ghastly doesn't think any one model is going to be the key to AGI. He likes LLMs for writing and web search, but he doesn't want to create a sentient AI. He wants to have real discussions about what happens when 90% of people are superfluous to the economy.

articles.summary: On Tuesday, OpenAI announced plans to develop an automated age-prediction system that will determine whether ChatGPT users are over or under 18. articles.title: Wake County Board of Education discusses AI uses in school, policy during work session
articles.author: Jon Dowding
articles.summary: Wake County Board of Education held the first in a series of meetings to discuss the development of the district's AI policy. articles.title: CU Boulder AI tool finds 1,000 predatory science journals
articles.author: Olivia Doak
articles.summary: Daniel Acuna developed an AI tool that can identify predatory scientific journals. The fake journals charge scientists hundreds or thousands of dollars and publish their research on the journal's website without offering any service. Out of nearly 15,200 scientific journals, the AI tool was able to identify more than 1,000 of them.

articles.title: Parents press Senate for AI rules
articles.author: Julia Shapero
articles.summary: Adam Raine, 16, died by suicide earlier this year. His father, Matthew, is suing OpenAI over his son's death, alleging that ChatGPT coached him to commit suicide. He testified before the Senate Judiciary Subcommittee on Crime and Counterterrorism on Tuesday.

articles.title: AI could detect heart risk from breast screening images, study suggests
articles.author: Storm Newton
articles.summary: Researchers in Australia developed an AI algorithm based on mammogram images from 49,196 women enrolled on the Lifepool cohort registry. The aim of the technology was to predict the risk of major cardiovascular disease, such as heart attacks and strokes, over 10 years. It performed as well as traditional calculators that use age and clinical variables to assess heart risks.

articles.title: AI calls on the rise as experts urge caution with answering the phone
articles.summary: AI can be used to replicate the voices of people who answer scam calls. It's important to be cautious about answering the phone if you don't have the caller in your contacts. Scammers try to look for people who easily give out their information. Older adults may appear to be vulnerable and easier to target for scammers.

articles.title: Parents call for guardrails on AI chatbots after suicides, self-harm

articles.title: The California-Washington tech fight heats up
articles.summary: California passed new AI laws that spooked the tech lobby. Many of the leading AI labs are based in the state, and the GOP worries that new rules will hinder innovation and adoption of the technology. California's relationship with the AI industry is not as adversarial as Republicans suggest.

According to a 2025 study, roughly 19% of U.S. adults reported using an AI system to simulate a romantic partner, with 21% preferring communication with AI over engaging with a real person.

articles.title: Unstoppable Martial Arts Robot Can Take a Direct Dropkick Without Falling Down

The research behind the stunt was conducted by scientists at the Active Intelligent Systems (ACT) Lab at the Southern University of Science and Technology in Shenzhen, China. The robot's incredible agility highlights how far the tech has come in a matter of years.

articles.title: Seismologists use AI to predict the next earthquake

Now, artificial intelligence is offering a glimmer of hope by analyzing vast amounts of data and helping scientists identify patterns that could signal an impending quake.

articles.title: Pentagon CTO wants AI on every desktop in 6 to 9 months

articles.title: Pentagon research official wants to have AI on every desktop in 6 to 9 months
articles.author: Alexandra Kelley
articles.summary: Pentagon wants to introduce artificial intelligence to its workforce within nine months. It follows the reorganization of its AI office. The Chief Digital and Artificial Intelligence Office (CDAO) will focus on research similar to the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency and Missile Defense Agency. It will be tailored to corporate workloads such as efficiency and intelligence.

articles.title: Researchers put Reddit's ‘AITA' questions into ChatGPT. It kept telling everyone they weren't the jerks.
